content:
Diagnosis:
T2N1M0 Grade 2 invasive ductal carcinoma of right breast
ER positive (8/8), PR low positive (2/8), HER2 negative
Diagnosed March 2024

Treatment:
Wide local excision and sentinel node biopsy 15 April 2024
3/12 nodes positive
Commenced adjuvant FEC chemotherapy 10 May 2024

Current situation:
Pre cycle 3 FEC chemotherapy

Current symptoms:
Mild fatigue, grade 1 nausea well controlled with antiemetics
No significant mucositis
No peripheral neuropathy

Examination:
Right breast wound well healed
No lymphadenopathy
Performance status 1

I reviewed [redacted name] today prior to cycle 3 FEC chemotherapy. She has tolerated the first two cycles reasonably well with only mild side effects as noted above. Her blood results today are satisfactory for proceeding with treatment. The surgical site continues to heal well with no concerns.

Plan:
Proceed with cycle 3 FEC today
Continue current antiemetic regime
Review in 3 weeks for cycle 4

primary_cancer.biomarker_status: ER positive (8/8), PR low positive (2/8), HER2 negative

cancer_timeline.value: Wide local excision and sentinel node biopsy with 3/12 nodes positive

patient_facts.value: Mild fatigue, grade 1 nausea well controlled with antiemetics
Right breast wound well healed, no lymphadenopathy

status_updates.value: Early breast cancer post surgery, tolerating adjuvant FEC chemotherapy with minimal side effects
Grade 1 nausea, mild fatigue, no significant mucositis or peripheral neuropathy
Proceeding with cycle 3 FEC chemotherapy with current antiemetic regime
